name: interventionism
content:

the practice or policy of a government taking action to become involved, either in the problems of another country, or in the economy of its own country: UN interventionism He set out a doctrine of humanitarian interventionism. See
interventionist
More examplesFewer examplesShe criticised the Western policy of military interventionism in the internal affairs of other states.Ministers defend their new interventionism as an attempt to help transforming industries.I believe the idea of liberal interventionism will survive as the best way of defending our interests and the moral way to promote our values.
